commit_message:
Add support for tcib_extra_config

Additional parameters to tcib tool like Dockerfile Args
can be passed via tcib extra_config[1]. It can be used while
building tripleo-ansible-ee container[2].

[1].https://docs.openstack.org/project-deploy-guide/tripleo-docs/latest/deployment/3rd_party.html#tips-and-tricks-with-tripleo-container-image-build
[2]. https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-common/+/776674
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ic1a588bb7eab9fbb7e813674b11d2b04b110a1e8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ci refs/changes/36/850736/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Add support for transferring encrypted volumes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-28 18:47:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/3fc5a3cf25138781602c8a235cb58a9d2eaabe6b', 'message': "Add support for transferring encrypted volumes

A new microversion 3.70 adds the ability to transfer a volume's
encryption key when transferring a volume to another project.

When the volume transfer is initiated, the volume's encryption
secret is essentially transferred to the cinder service.
- The cinder service creates a new encryption_key_id that contains
  a copy of the volume's encryption secret.
- The volume (and its snapshots) is updated with the new
  encryption_key_id (the one owned by the cinder service).
- The volume's original encryption_key_id (owned by the volume's
  owner) is deleted.

When the transfer is accepted, the secret is transferred to the
user accepting the transfer.
- A new encryption_key_id is generated on behalf of the new user
  that contains a copy of the volume's encryption secret.
- The volume (and its snapshots) is updated with the new
  encryption_key_id (the one owned by the user).
- The intermediate encryption_key_id owned by the cinder service
  is deleted.

When a transfer is cancelled (deleted), the same process is used
to transfer ownship back to the user that cancelled the transfer.

Implements: bp/transfer-encrypted-volume
Change-Id: I459f06504e90025c9c0b539981d3d56a2a9394c7

commit_message:
Add support for transferring encrypted volumes

A new microversion 3.70 adds the ability to transfer a volume's
encryption key when transferring a volume to another project.

When the volume transfer is initiated, the volume's encryption
secret is essentially transferred to the cinder service.
- The cinder service creates a new encryption_key_id that contains
  a copy of the volume's encryption secret.
- The volume (and its snapshots) is updated with the new
  encryption_key_id (the one owned by the cinder service).
- The volume's original encryption_key_id (owned by the volume's
  owner) is deleted.

When the transfer is accepted, the secret is transferred to the
user accepting the transfer.
- A new encryption_key_id is generated on behalf of the new user
  that contains a copy of the volume's encryption secret.
- The volume (and its snapshots) is updated with the new
  encryption_key_id (the one owned by the user).
- The intermediate encryption_key_id owned by the cinder service
  is deleted.

When a transfer is cancelled (deleted), the same process is used
to transfer ownship back to the user that cancelled the transfer.

Implements: blueprint transfer-encrypted-volume
Change-Id: I459f06504e90025c9c0b539981d3d56a2a9394c7

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from castellan.common.credentials import keystone_password from castellan import key_manager as castellan_key_manager from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log as logging from cinder import context from cinder import objects LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CONF = cfg.CONF class KeyTransfer(object): def __init__(self, conf: cfg.ConfigOpts): self.conf = conf self.service_context = keystone_password.KeystonePassword( password=conf.keystone_authtoken.password, auth_url=conf.keystone_authtoken.auth_url, username=conf.keystone_authtoken.username, user_domain_name=conf.keystone_authtoken.user_domain_name, project_name=conf.keystone_authtoken.project_name, project_domain_name=conf.keystone_authtoken.project_domain_name) def transfer_key(self, volume: objects.volume.Volume, src_context: context.RequestContext, dst_context: context.RequestContext) -> None: """Transfer the key from the src_context to the dst_context.""" key_manager = castellan_key_manager.API(self.conf) old_encryption_key_id = volume.encryption_key_id new_encryption_key_id = key_manager.store( dst_context, key_manager.get(src_context, old_encryption_key_id)) volume.encryption_key_id = new_encryption_key_id volume.save() snapshots = objects.snapshot.SnapshotList.get_all_for_volume( context.get_admin_context(), volume.id) for snapshot in snapshots: snapshot.encryption_key_id = new_encryption_key_id snapshot.save() key_manager.delete(src_context, old_encryption_key_id) def transfer_create(context: context.RequestContext, volume: objects.volume.Volume, conf: cfg.ConfigOpts = CONF) -> None: """Transfer the key from the owner to the cinder service.""" LOG.info("Initiating transfer of encryption key for volume %s", volume.id) key_transfer = KeyTransfer(conf) key_transfer.transfer_key(volume, src_context=context, dst_context=key_transfer.service_context) def transfer_accept(context: context.RequestContext, volume: objects.volume.Volume, conf: cfg.ConfigOpts = CONF) -> None: """Transfer the key from the cinder service to the recipient.""" LOG.info("Accepting transfer of encryption key for volume %s", volume.id) key_transfer = KeyTransfer(conf) key_transfer.transfer_key(volume, src_context=key_transfer.service_context, dst_context=context) def transfer_delete(context: context.RequestContext, volume: objects.volume.Volume, conf: cfg.ConfigOpts = CONF) -> None: """Transfer the key from the cinder service back to the owner.""" LOG.info("Cancelling transfer of encryption key for volume %s", volume.id) key_transfer = KeyTransfer(conf) key_transfer.transfer_key(volume, src_context=key_transfer.service_context, dst_context=context)

commit_message:
Add prelude section for Zed releasenote

This update is to add a summary of changes focusing on major updates
in Zed release.

Signed-off-by: Yasufumi Ogawa <yasufum.o@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0b256cc7bbec45f28f4ca79971dd2407d2d3958f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/43/856243/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: > The 8.0.0 release includes many new features and bug fixes. Please be sure to read the upgrade section which describes the required actions to upgrade your cloud from 7.0.0 (Yoga) to 8.0.0 (Zed). There are a few major updates introduced in Zed. - ETSI NFV V2 APIs for CNF Heal, Scale and Rollback operation. - VNF AutoHealing triggered by FaultNotification. - Individual VNFc management using HOT. - OpenID for Kubernetes VIM Authentication. - Robot framework for ETSI NFV based auto testing. - Database synchronization between of Tacker and Kubernetes to enable maintainers to get status of pods from Tacker. - Functional tests for CentOS.

commit_message:
Add releasenote for remove cnf restriction

Add releasenote for the following update.

* Enable multiple VNFs creation from one package [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tacker/+/838908

Implements: blueprint remove-cnf-restriction
Change-Id: I9f2e602f465da17f1e405c70c3a84771466f5bff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker refs/changes/83/856983/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- upgrade: - | Enable the creation of multiple VNF from a single VNF package during CNF instantiation (V1 API) by specifying ``vdu_mapping`` parameter in additionalParams.

commit_message:
Helm chart support for CNF v2 API

This patch enables CNF v2 API to operate using Helm chart.

New vimType 'ETSINFV.HELM.V_3' is introduced.

Since helm VIM uses existing functions of k8s VIM, k8s VIM code
is refactored to share between k8s VIM and helm VIM.

Implements: blueprint helmchart-k8s-vim
Change-Id: I0329a0d43294181b7ffb1494bb5dd2d0528eb5dc

commit_message:
[stable-only] Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic3df0e5545a77eed01a66520ca62f241390c043d

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Icb4424810fc7e6ff4933bc93c6cd1b1315449328

subject: Expose group in Volume OVO
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-03-09 20:30:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/dfd4fb8745fd92d5efb0474d12aa301743b2bcc5', 'message': "Expose group in Volume OVO

In change-id Iabf9c3fab56ffef50695ce45745f193273822b39 we left the
`consistency_group` out of the expected attributes of the Volume OVO
(even when te DB layer is providing that information) because it was
breaking some unit tests.

The `consistency_group` was later replaced with `group` (generic groups)
and that data is also returned by the DB.

This means that in some cases we are unnecessarily loading the group
again (manually or via lazy loading) once we have the volume OVO because
that field is not set.

In this patch we populate the `group` when we load the Volume OVO from
the DB.

We don't add the `consistency_group` field because the code around that
should be removed from Cinder, so there's no point in making changes
related to it.

Change-Id: Ib090421e5903f1f89c18e5e5d9655f0768d78bce

commit_message:
Expose group in Volume OVO

In change-id Iabf9c3fab56ffef50695ce45745f193273822b39 we left the
`consistency_group` out of the expected attributes of the Volume OVO
(even when te DB layer is providing that information) because it was
breaking some unit tests.

The `consistency_group` was later replaced with `group` (generic groups)
and that data is also returned by the DB.

This means that in some cases we are unnecessarily loading the group
again (manually or via lazy loading) once we have the volume OVO because
that field is not set.

In this patch we populate the `group` when we load the Volume OVO from
the DB.

We don't add the `consistency_group` field because the code around that
should be removed from Cinder, so there's no point in making changes
related to it.

Change-Id: Ib090421e5903f1f89c18e5e5d9655f0768d78bce

commit_message:
TOX: Document install_command usage

This patch documents in tox.ini the change introduced by change-id
Ic9a6ac412a334710eb5e45935cd301ca80a5edb9 where we use "install_command"
to prevent installing dependencies without constraints.

We document it to prevent people from thinking that just adding the
constraints in "deps" is enough and removing the "install_command" line.

Change-Id: Iccd84cb5d4db78e4953d58a05392c61b08988d4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/25/840525/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE: Do not remove the install_command because for most of our tox jobs we # use the usedevelop, which means that tox will do a pip install -e on # our source code on its own. # So it first installs deps (which has the constraints) and then cinder # without constraints, because they are defined in deps, pulling cinder # dependencies ignoring the constraints, pulling untested dependencies # that can break things.

commit_message:
Remove unneeded parameter tripleo_frr_ovn_bgp_agent_bridge_mappings

Thanks to [1] the agent itself is in charge of managing the
arp/ndp status of the bridges. So no need to handle this at
deployment time

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/x/ovn-bgp-agent/+/854957

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/855330
Change-Id: Ib56f836dae8dae90376f0067037635229f11ee19
(cherry picked from commit 634b33e57f1ac4ef2b70a641f076ffd2e2ab05af)

subject: Restart tuned service to apply tuned boot options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-12 11:17:13.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_kernel/tasks/kernelargs.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/6ea4188307d1acc7ea7a6eda3d4674b853c3c0c4', 'message': 'Restart tuned service to apply tuned boot options

During BM node provisioning, the tuned-role is enabled before
kernelarg-role for NFV usescase. The grub2-mkconfig in kernel args
overwrites the $tuned_params BLS config.  Restarting tuned service,
so that the tuned boot options gets re-applied and
is set from /boot/loader/entires after node reboot

Change-Id: I28d7f64e8433fb96f7549e92fa8b048732683534
'}]
commit_message:
Restart tuned service to apply tuned boot options

During BM node provisioning, the tuned-role is enabled before
kernelarg-role for NFV usescase. The grub2-mkconfig in kernel args
overwrites the $tuned_params BLS config.  Restarting tuned service,
so that the tuned boot options gets re-applied and
is set from /boot/loader/entires after node reboot

Change-Id: I28d7f64e8433fb96f7549e92fa8b048732683534
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/40/857040/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # BZ: bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2107896 # grub2-mkconfig updates the BLS entries, # hence $tuned_params gets overwritten. # Restart tuned service to re-apply kernel args - name: Restart tuned service block become: true block: - name: Check for tuned-adm service command: >- which tuned-adm environment: PATH: "/bin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/usr/sbin" register: tuned_installed - name: Restart tuned systemd: name: tuned state: restarted enabled: true when: tuned_installed.rc == 0

subject: NetApp: Fix terminate_connection on unmapped vol
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-27 11:31:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/f4ad4b4cf13720e00cfb9078e6e473024642ec3f', 'message': 'NetApp: Fix terminate_connection on unmapped vol

In NetApp iSCSI and FC drivers, when Cinder calls terminate_connection
on a volume that is not mapped (for example if we have manually removed
the mapped in the backend), we'll get the following error:

commit_message:
NetApp: Fix terminate_connection on unmapped vol

In NetApp iSCSI and FC drivers, when Cinder calls terminate_connection
on a volume that is not mapped (for example if we have manually removed
the mapping in the backend), we'll get the following error:

  Error unmapping LUN. Code :13115, Message: Invalid value specified for
  "initiator-group" element within "lun-unmap": "".

This prevents the terminate_connection from succeeding.

This patch changes this behavior and just issues a warning.

This is consistent with how we allow an initialize_connection to succeed
even if the mapping is already present (we fail the mapping, and then
try to get an existing mapping).

Closes-Bug: #1880862
Change-Id: I6e77bafe44fddd61abd8faa68215b4fd7930cfa5

commit_message:
fix database sync always get the wrong  value

we create a default pool  when exec database sync, and get the
default_pool_id from designate.conf, but we did not register this
opt before using  it, so we always get the default value which is
wrong

Change-Id: I500c932a502db24332aad95c54713b7056bc1df4
Closes-Bug: 1881277
Related-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla-ansible/+bug/1855877
(cherry picked from commit 609437e73deff55e9f5548538f093d01f0addd1b)

commit_message:
Switch FIPS job to CentOS 9

The FIPS job was merged on stable/wallaby using CentOS 8. However
we should be testing FIPS using CentOS 9 on stable brances as well.

Change-Id: I15399d4b70a4497186ffa654045e34c08d9c0c93

commit_message:
SoftwareRAID: Enable skipping RAIDS

Extend the ability to skip disks to RAID devices
This allows users to specify the volume name of
a logical device in the skip list which is then not cleaned
or created again during the create/apply configuration phase
The volume name can be specified in target raid config provided
the change https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ironic-python-agent/+/853182/
passes

Story: 2010233

Change-Id: Ib9290a97519bc48e585e1bafb0b60cc14e621e0f

subject: Fix software raid output poisoning
revisions:

commit_message:
Fix software raid output poisoning

In the event a device name is set to contain a raid device path,
it is possible for the Name and Events field values of mdadm's
detailed output to contain text which inadvertently gets captured and
mapped as component data for the "holder" devices of the RAID set.

This would cause invalid values to get passed to UEFI methods
which would cause a deployment to fail under these circumstances.

We now ignore the Name and Events fields in mdadm output.

Change-Id: If721dfe1caa5915326482969e55fbf4697538231
(cherry picked from commit f3e3de8097f05cc830768da7d3f3e9eae04b40a1)
(cherry picked from commit 6660e01e1f8a6e7a40b798eea5215b1eddcbe0c3)
(cherry picked from commit 5751f60353f3a4bf325a8c9335d743eec45fbcd1)

commit_message:
Add the ability to specify custom additional galera users

This provides the capability to add and remove additional users
in the Galera database which may be used by external resource
monitoring systems (for example).

The Ansible mysql 'resource_limits' variable is also exposed to
enable setting connection limits against individual users.

Change-Id: Idcc9251340215baf5e6f550a9ca844c8c097d353

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Maskari is supported from Stein so rocky removed

Change-Id: I590dea4256787e4576b7e2a573b42376424f0425

We should fix this. basepython = python3 passenv = HOME TERM CS_* OS_* TEST_* deps = -r{toxinidir}/src/test-requirements.txt changedir = {toxinidir}/src commands = bash -c "if [ ! -f ../*.charm ]; then echo 'Charm does not exist. Run tox -e build'; exit 1; fi" tox --version tox -e func-target {posargs}
deleted_lines: [testenv:py35] basepython = python3.5 deps = -r{toxinidir}/test-requirements.txt commands = stestr run --slowest {posargs}

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Maskari is supported from Stein so rocky tests removed

Change-Id: I8c6fbfe37794da1b5db9929fe59ea0556fb2c361

commit_message:
[NetApp] Consider last transfer size and error for replica state

In order to determine replica state from snapmirror, in addition to
existing check of last-transfer-end-timestamp', also add new checks
of `last-transfer-size` and `last-transfer-error`. New config option
`netapp_snapmirror_last_transfer_size_limit` added with default value
of 1MB. The last-transfer-size above this value or presence of any
last-transfer-error is considered as replica is out_of_sync.

Closes-bug: #1989175
Change-Id: I6d038244493583cc943063b50d731b8c1ef5ed28

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap virtualenv for py37

py37 test started to fail with latest virtualenv (20.16.4) as it
bundles setuptools 65.3.0, which causes installation problems under
py37. (Note: with py38 the problem does not occur).

This patch sets virtualenv<20.16.4 to unblock the gate as
virtualenv 20.16.3 bundles setuptools 63.4.1, with which py37 gate
works well.

Change-Id: I7f69bcf7ae9526bb5b55dc7a65e85cee6cb64790

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I728a06f93b55d012440d6ed7d2527a32c4a1bb85
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/44/857744/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I2331185f4b69cbcaf8f60265cd92f363cfc9936f

commit_message:
Update register_machine to use the Ironic format for ports

It's confusing to use two different formats across the SDK.

Also allow a simple list of MAC addresses, since that's what most people
presumably want.

Change-Id: I47448850225f04f24fb0dfc6a1700b5e2c26a450

commit_message:
Migrate register_machine to use the proxy layer

The cloud layer now runs cleaning by default, which can be skipped by
passing provision_state=enroll or manageable. As an upside, it now
supports all fields in newer microversions.

Change-Id: I03f01719ddf0e1aef60a9fcc92fe327ce8c8bb96
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/02/849402/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ``enroll``, which matches the Ironic's default. .. warning:: Using ``provision_state=available`` is only possible with API versions 1.1 to 1.10 and thus is incompatible with setting any fields that appeared after 1.11. expected_provision_state = 'enroll' raise ValueError( "Node's provision_state must be one of %s for creation, " "got %s" % (', '.join(_common.STATE_VERSIONS), expected_provision_state)) else: expected_version = self._assert_microversion_for( # Nodes cannot be created directly as available using new API versions microversion = ('1.10' if expected_provision_state == 'available' else expected_version) super(Node, self).create(session, *args, microversion=microversion, **kwargs)
deleted_lines: ``available``, since it's the only state supported by all API versions. expected_provision_state = 'available' if expected_provision_state not in ('enroll', 'manageable', 'available'): raise ValueError( "Node's provision_state must be one of 'enroll', " "'manageable' or 'available' for creation, got %s" % expected_provision_state) pass else: self._assert_microversion_for( super(Node, self).create(session, *args, **kwargs)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-15 16:02:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/7bdac37602002126e8967f94e98c5cf1111b60b9', 'message': 'Remove config of desginate binds as forward resovlers

The configuration of bind hosts as forwarding resolvers is incorrect and
must be removed.

Change-Id: I116253b60df1dc41237e06db9f6938c2bd3edd2e
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-08-17 13:40:39.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/53a06d544ec8e017d5196dccc301285e9786d50f', 'message': 'Remove config of designate binds as forward resolvers

The configuration of bind hosts as forwarding resolvers is incorrect and
must be removed.

Change-Id: I116253b60df1dc41237e06db9f6938c2bd3edd2e
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2022-08-19 01:07:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/commit/4f8df4fd8f499e9311adccc5bdff34de312ed1b7', 'message': 'Unbound: remove incorrect config of forwarding

Configuring forwarders is only valid if tripleo_unbound_resolvers is
defined and should also never be set to bind servers that are meant to
be authoritative.

The intention is that the forwarder configuration only be generated if
tripleo_unbound_forwarded_resolvers is configured with actual values.
This patch includes a fix to the conditional to skip creating the file
and also removes it in case it the deployment parameters no longer

commit_message:
Unbound: remove incorrect config of forwarding

Configuring forwarders is only valid if
tripleo_unbound_forward_resolvers is defined and should also never be
set to bind servers that are meant to be authoritative.

The intention is that the forwarder configuration only be generated if
tripleo_unbound_forward_resolvers is configured with actual values.
This patch includes a fix to the conditional to skip creating the file
and also removes it in case it the deployment parameters no longer
include tripleo_unbound_forward_resolvers on redeploy.

Change-Id: I116253b60df1dc41237e06db9f6938c2bd3edd2e

subject: Ensure openstack-release package is correct after install hook
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-14 15:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['hooks/keystone_hooks.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone/commit/2c33c74c8fb78ecfd61060663fb7b1a649fbd7d6', 'message': 'Ensure openstack-release package is correct after install hook

The linked bug shows the install of the charm with openstack-origin set
to zed.  This happens because configure_installation_source() causes the
openstack-release package to be installed *before* the zed cloud archive
sources are configured into /etc/apt and an apt update done. This means
that the openstack-release package says "yoga" despite the zed packages
actually being installed.

Then, on the config-changed hook, it sees that the installed version is
showing as yoga and tries to do an upgrade.  This fails, as the charm
hasn't yet bootstrapped, and the charm tries to bootstrap after
upgrading the packages.

There's a few bugs here which are exposed, but the tactical fix is to
force the openstack-release to match the installed packages.

Change-Id: I3f47daf6bda6b62ffe4152ede2709f802f0ab606
Closes-Bug: #1989538
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure openstack-release package is correct after install hook

The linked bug shows the install of the charm with openstack-origin set
to zed.  This happens because configure_installation_source() causes the
openstack-release package to be installed *before* the zed cloud archive
sources are configured into /etc/apt and an apt update done. This means
that the openstack-release package says "yoga" despite the zed packages
actually being installed.

Then, on the config-changed hook, it sees that the installed version is
showing as yoga and tries to do an upgrade.  This fails, as the charm
hasn't yet bootstrapped, and the charm tries to bootstrap after
upgrading the packages.

There's a few bugs here which are exposed, but the tactical fix is to
force the openstack-release to match the installed packages.

Change-Id: I3f47daf6bda6b62ffe4152ede2709f802f0ab606
Closes-Bug: #1989538
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-keystone refs/changes/29/857729/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # (ajkavanagh) LP: #1989538 # Tactical fix to force openstack-release to match the configured # installation source; note that it comes after apt_update(). apt_install(['openstack-release'], fatal=False, quiet=True)

commit_message:
Prevent incorrect reschedule of resumed tasks with jobboard

A previous patch [0] introduced a keepalive mechanism that allows a
controller to notify taskflow that a task is being executed.
But it doesn't handle "resumed" tasks (tasks that have been rescheduled
from one controller to another controller).

This patch moves this keepalive task in a thread that is attached to a
taskflow conductor, the thread will extend the expiration of the tasks
that are executed by this conductor.

[0] I6619ba117f7051fe44086389789bc6e2810fd23d

Story 2009998
Task 45089

Change-Id: I29fcad9e121a30d6e8f8178f2f078cf10771a32a

Update charm README template

Change-Id: I610b7ad04be23497e128a156c4d5521caaa089e4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/charm-guide refs/changes/23/857523/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: As exceptions to the above rule, some charms are so closely related that it makes sense for each to show both (e.g. `swift-proxy`_ and `swift-storage`_, or `ceph-mon`_ and `ceph-osd`_), especially if the space required is minimal. Use common sense. There is no need to call out specific actions in the README. However, makealways include this boilerplate text, and :doc:`alert <../contact>` the team if Policy overrides allow an operator to override the default policy of an OpenStack service. See [Policy overrides][cg-policy-overrides] for more information on this feature. [cg-ha-apps]: https://docs.openstack.org/charm-guide/latest/admin/ha.html#ha-applications
deleted_lines: As exceptions to the above rule, subordinate charms can include the deployment steps of a principal charm (e.g. `cinder-ceph`_ and cinder). Also, some charms are so closely related that it makes sense for each to show both (e.g. `swift-proxy`_ and `swift-storage`_, or `ceph-mon`_ and `ceph-osd`_), especially if the space required is minimal. Use common sense. There is no need to call out specific actions in the README. However, makealways include this boilerplate text, and :doc:`Alert <../contact>` the team if Policy overrides is a feature that allows an operator to override the default policy of an OpenStack service. commit_message:
Fix leftover devices when copying data

We will have leftover devices on generic offline migration and generic
revert to snapshot when cinder attaches a volume on the controller node
and the device presented on the system for the volume is not usable.

This is caused by cinder not disconnecting the volume when a call to
check_valid_device returns False in the manager's _connect_device
method.

Closes-Bug: #1880945
Change-Id: Id388f83dcc908bd0693142f33b482912a12577db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/61/731261/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- fixes: - | Fix leftover devices on generic offline migration and generic revert to snapshot that happen when cinder attaches a volume on the controller node and the device presented on the system for the volume is not usable. (bug 1880945).

commit_message:
Populate /var/www/cgi-bin/ironic/ with wsgi app

Rather than rely on deployment-time configuration, set up the wsgi
executable during image build.

This is already done in other containers such as keystone and cinder.

Change-Id: I2282ea692983be76fc729c0225d76c0bded51bb9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-common refs/changes/59/854459/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - run: mkdir -p /var/www/cgi-bin/ironic && chown -R ironic /var/www/cgi-bin/ironic - run: cp -a /usr/bin/ironic-api-wsgi /var/www/cgi-bin/ironic/app

commit_message:
Fix illegal shell characters

This change checks if the user input is legal.
if illegal, we raise an InvalidValue excepiton.

Story: 2010004
Task: 45128

Change-Id: Ib81646b8f8a01fcbc31d033ec205491b76a7b755

added_lines: import shlex def validate_command(string): """ Check if the string is legal for command raise invalidvalue if illegal """ if string != shlex.quote(string): raise exception.InvalidValue(value=string)

commit_message:
Prelude section for Zed release

We need it before RC1.

Change-Id: Ib674ca6a13f7c5d0254b222effa20d1948a80fe5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/67/857467/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: --- prelude: | The 26.0.0 release includes many new features and bug fixes. Please be sure to read the upgrade section which describes the required actions to upgrade your cloud from 25.0.0 (Xena) to 26.0.0 (Zed). There are a few major changes worth mentioning. This is not an exhaustive list: - The latest Compute API microversion supported for Yoga is `v2.93`__. .. __: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#maximum-in-zed - `Virtual IOMMU devices`__ can now be created and attached to an instance when running on a x86 host and using the libvirt driver. .. __: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/pci-passthrough.html#virtual-iommu-support - Improved behavior for Windows guest by adding by default following `Hyper-V enlightments`__ on all libvirt guests : `vpindex`, `runtime`, `synic`, `reset`, `frequencies`, `reenlightenment`, `tlbflush`, `ipi` and `evmc`. .. __: https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#hypervisor-features - All lifecycle actions are now fully supported for `instances with vDPA ports`__, including vDPA hot-plug live migration, suspend and attach/detach. .. __: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/admin/vdpa.html - Volume-backed instances (instances with root disk attached as a volume) can now be rebuilt by specifying a 2.93 microversion instead of returning a HTTP400 exception. - The `unshelve` instance API action now provides a new `host` parameter with 2.91 microversion (for only admins). - With microversion 2.92, you can only import a public key and not generate a keypair. You can also use an extended name pattern. - Nova policies now remove by default system scopes for all APIs hence finishing to implement `phase #1 of new RBAC guidelines`__ that are opt-in. .. __: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/consistent-and-secure-rbac.html#phase-1

commit_message:
Release glance RC1 for Zed

This proposed a RC1 release for glance to get any merged changes
out prior to the RC1 deadline for Zed going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by early Friday, September 16.

Signed-off-by: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>
Change-Id: Icd988696e277e839a023ffe6967e5a721dff08de

Add memory overcommit caution

added_lines: .. caution:: Using a RAM allocation ratio above 1:1 can impact running VMs if all available memory on the hypervisor is used. If sufficient swap space is not available the system will have to rely on OOM killer to free space which can have a detrimental effect on running VMs.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-12 07:10:36.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/senlin-dashboard/commit/6cc9c831e26ea11069fac580614e5b7605c9673b', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of dash-separated
options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores. Without
this, we see 'UserWarning' messages like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

Change-Id: I9fe64b5705d81a08d28f9941bfb67b3e477e4a9a

commit_message:
sharder: trivial tidy up of unit tests

Move one of the unit tests covering *root* container audit that was
located between tests covering *shard* containers and their helper
method.

Rename, add comments and add clarifying sanity checks to other unit
tests.

Change-Id: I2bffea2d123d8a345dac53159bc02c8b298153b8

commit_message:
list floating ip api contains port forwarding id

Neutron has added a new extension `floating-ip-port-forwarding-detail`,
which defines that when listing floating ip, it returns the port
forwardng's id and 'internal_port_id'.
This patch updates the list floating ip verification content.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/840565

Change-Id: I5a82d745a9bd9d098ddf8902cdd58d1e81bd80ea

setup.cfg: Replace dashes with underscores

Setuptools v54.1.0 introduces a warning that the use of
dash-separated options in 'setup.cfg' will not be supported
in a future version [1].
Get ahead of the issue by replacing the dashes with underscores.
Without this, we see 'UserWarning' messages
like the following on new enough
versions of setuptools:

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: Ice3096cde812d99020a7af37cb86821502fff9b8

commit_message:
Remove secure_proxy_ssl_header opt from Glance

Glance uses http-proxy-to-wsgi middleware from oslo.middleware in
its pipeline in order to efficiently forward request headers in case
of load balancer style deployments. Hence, the configuration option
``secure_proxy_ssl_header`` was marked as deprecated.

This patch removes the option and the support for it within Glance
to entirely rely on oslo middleware. This will ensure that the related
headers set by oslo.middleware:HTTPProxyToWSGI is never modified in
Glance.

Change-Id: I11d41bb736bbfd90030d88245c11642823e4c400
Closes-Bug: 1673908

Typical value is ' '"HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO".')), ] CONF.register_opts(wsgi_opts) if CONF.secure_proxy_ssl_header: scheme = environ.get(CONF.secure_proxy_ssl_header) if scheme: environ['wsgi.url_scheme'] = scheme

commit_message:
Passphrase parameters should be secret

Passphrase parameters are considered to be secret information and
should not appear in logs even when debug is enabled.

This change marks the following two passphrase parameters as secrets
and ensures actual values are hidden in oslo.config debug logs.
 - [certificates] server_certs_key_passphrase
 - [certificates] ca_private_key_passphrase

Change-Id: I623aa9b42ea40bdf420f124b981b7755e6c630f8
(cherry picked from commit b0032b7bf98af98276b6419d179b8501fc450a47)

subject: Fix Redis connection over TLS
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-07 18:42:40.000000000', 'files': ['designate/cmd/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/designate/commit/93dee6a3ff44fb7470b3008e8fbbaf99822bbe82', 'message': 'Fix Redis connection over TLS

When Designate is configured to use Redis for coordination over a TLS connection, it will fail to connect with "ssl.SSLError: ('timed out',)".
This is caused by eventlet raising ssl.SSLError instead of the expected socket timeout the core libraries return.
This patch monkey-patches eventlet to return the proper exception.

Closes-Bug: #1989020
Change-Id: I5bd1c10d863212683752e05bb450e6f531ff7e72
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Redis connection over TLS

When Designate is configured to use Redis for coordination over a TLS connection, it will fail to connect with "ssl.SSLError: ('timed out',)".
This is caused by eventlet raising ssl.SSLError instead of the expected socket timeout the core libraries return.
This patch monkey-patches eventlet to return the proper exception.

Closes-Bug: #1989020
Change-Id: I5bd1c10d863212683752e05bb450e6f531ff7e72
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/designate refs/changes/13/856313/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from eventlet.green import ssl import socket # Work around the eventlet issue that impacts redis using TLS. # https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/692 ssl.timeout_exc = socket.timeout

commit_message:
Tests: Monkey patch before logs are loaded

Our tests don't do the eventlet monkey patching in the same way that the
Cinder services -backup, scheduler, volume- do.

This patch changes this by doing the monkey patching as soon as
possible, before cinder OVOs are loaded and bring in a number of oslo
libraries.

When copying the initialization part from the Cinder commands a fix for
'current_thread' is also copied.

Change-Id: I6c44d557466dfcb1f6507917eb88959e2ff388df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/60/854260/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os # Monkey patching must go before the oslo.log import, otherwise # oslo.context will not use greenthread thread local and all greenthreads # will share the same context. if os.name == 'nt': # eventlet monkey patching the os module causes subprocess.Popen to fail # on Windows when using pipes due to missing non-blocking IO support. eventlet.monkey_patch(os=False) else: eventlet.monkey_patch() # Monkey patch the original current_thread to use the up-to-date _active # global variable. See https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1863021 and # https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/592 import __original_module_threading as orig_threading # pylint: disable=E0401 import threading # noqa orig_threading.current_thread.__globals__['_active'] = threading._active

commit_message:
Use stable constraint in tox to release new tag for Zed

We are going to release Tempest new tag to declare the start of
support for stable/zed. So that new tag use stable/zed
constraint in the tox env.

For example: if anyone use Tempest new tag (32.0.0) in future say
1 year later then tox env also should use the zed contstraint for
compatibility instead master.

These need to be move back to master constraint once release is done.

Change-Id: I188a23bf77855358535986256b17fcc4cc6405f9

added_lines: --- prelude: | This release is to tag Tempest for OpenStack Zed release. This release marks the start of Zed release support in Tempest. After this release, Tempest will support below OpenStack Releases: * Zed * Yoga * Xena * Wallaby Current development of Tempest is for OpenStack 2023.1 development cycle. Every Tempest commit is also tested against master during the 2023.1 cycle. However, this does not necessarily mean that using Tempest as of this tag will work against a 2023.1 (or future release) cloud. To be on safe side, use this tag to test the OpenStack Zed release.

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap virtualenv for py37

py37 test started to fail with latest virtualenv (20.16.4) as it
bundles setuptools 65.3.0, which causes installation problems under
py37. (Note: with py38 the problem does not occur

This patch sets virtualenv<20.16.4 to unblock the gate as
virtualenv 20.16.3 bundles setuptools 63.4.1, with which py37 gate
works well.

Co-Authored-By: Elod Illes <elod.illes@est.tech>

Change-Id: I8c92761b05ba01bff00b16215477e216e4b97065
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/octavia refs/changes/89/856689/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Pin setuptools via virtualenv as latest virtualenv pulls in 65.3.0 # version of setuptools for py37, which causes installation problems # (virtualenv 20.16.3 uses setuptools 63.4.1). requires = virtualenv<20.16.4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-14 09:12:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/compute.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/3b37752c92ed486578a8291bb5e7bbfe2ce29891', 'message': "Config parameters for min/max cpu/memory allocation.

This would allow an operator to limit how large allocations are allowed against
a certain hypervisor. For instance this can be useful to ensure that VM's that
would othervise be allocated all CPU's of a hyperviser would be scheduled on
another larger hypervisor.

This changes adds the configuration-parameters:
 - [defaut] min_instance_vcpus
 - [defaut] max_instance_vcpus

 - [defaut] max_instance_memory_mb

It these parameters are not set they will default to the old behaviour.

Change-Id: I7a46023e3c039d7b95f301a0bebc9ed122f6f3b1
"}]
commit_message:
Config parameters for min/max cpu/memory allocation.

This would allow an operator to limit how large allocations are allowed against
a certain hypervisor. For instance this can be useful to ensure that VM's that
would othervise be allocated all CPU's of a hyperviser would be scheduled on
another larger hypervisor.

This changes adds the configuration-parameters:
 - [defaut] min_instance_vcpus
 - [defaut] max_instance_vcpus
 - [defaut] min_instance_memory_mb
 - [defaut] max_instance_memory_mb

It these parameters are not set they will default to the old behaviour.

Change-Id: I7a46023e3c039d7b95f301a0bebc9ed122f6f3b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/95/857595/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: max_memory = CONF.max_instance_memory_mb 'min_unit': CONF.min_instance_memory_mb, 'max_unit': max_memory if max_memory else memory_mb, max_vcpus = CONF.max_instance_vcpus 'min_unit': CONF.min_instance_vcpus, 'max_unit': max_vcpus if max_vcpus else vcpus,

subject: Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-14 08:27:26.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/db/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty/commit/15b2bfb8290720e08c7c124d52dccc3ae5d24d43', 'message': "Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0

oslo.db 12.1.0 has changed the default value for the 'autocommit'
parameter of 'LegacyEngineFacade' from 'True' to 'False'. This is a
necessary step to ensure compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0. However, we
are currently relying on the autocommit behavior and need changes to
explicitly manage sessions. Until that happens, we need to override the

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia0e9696dcaafd90f9c6daeb68c72fa2b184823fb
(cherry picked from commit 0ea32a2b51438b55130082e54f30fc9c97bd9d85)

commit_message:
Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0

oslo.db 12.1.0 has changed the default value for the 'autocommit'
parameter of 'LegacyEngineFacade' from 'True' to 'False'. This is a
necessary step to ensure compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0. However, we
are currently relying on the autocommit behavior and need changes to
explicitly manage sessions. Until that happens, we need to override the
default.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia0e9696dcaafd90f9c6daeb68c72fa2b184823fb
(cherry picked from commit 0ea32a2b51438b55130082e54f30fc9c97bd9d85)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/88/857588/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(priteau): Remove autocommit=True (and ideally use of # LegacyEngineFacade) asap since it's not compatible with SQLAlchemy # 2.0. _FACADE = session.EngineFacade.from_config(cfg.CONF, sqlite_fk=True, autocommit=True)

Change-Id: Ib1bae260b8b5289e9a6c80baf2de9e908f977d09

commit_message:
Tests: Fix service stopping on cleanup

Our services don't have a 'kill' method, they have a 'stop' method, so
it doesn't make any sense to call the 'kill' method on them during test
cleanup.

This patch changes the 'kill' call with the right 'stop' call.

Change-Id: Ib1bae260b8b5289e9a6c80baf2de9e908f977d09
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/59/854259/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Stop any services (this stops RPC handlers) x.stop()

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I3421b0eac56433edad6fe3efebcbde372402ab8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-prometheus-exporter refs/changes/19/857319/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Do not add cacert when it does not exist
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-12 13:42:30.000000000', 'files': ['handlers/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server/commit/571595f427915ca271f3cea11fbce7a5d22c0917', 'message': "Do not add cacert when it does not exist

Right now we assume, that ca-cert is always present. Though, it might
not be the case for user-provided certs or let's encrypt, as they
are already in ca-certificates.

Change-Id: I101f82c5e378596e76a160aacb34a9e1e7e0c123
(cherry picked from commit dd842f4eb4cfc0e81aea13665c7be2994a289160)
(cherry picked from commit 108aafdef04da2ce6ec000c9751761dbdbd6f95a)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not add cacert when it does not exist

Right now we assume, that ca-cert is always present. Though, it might
not be the case for user-provided certs or let's encrypt, as they
are already in ca-certificates.

Change-Id: I101f82c5e378596e76a160aacb34a9e1e7e0c123
(cherry picked from commit dd842f4eb4cfc0e81aea13665c7be2994a289160)
(cherry picked from commit 108aafdef04da2ce6ec000c9751761dbdbd6f95a)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-haproxy_server refs/changes/55/857055/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cat {{ item_base_path ~ '.crt' }} $(test -f {{ item_base_path ~ '-ca.crt' }} && echo {{ item_base_path ~ '-ca.crt' }}) {{ item_base_path ~ '.key' }} > {{ item_base_path ~ '.pem' }} vars: item_base_path: "{{ haproxy_ssl_cert_path ~ '/haproxy_' ~ ansible_facts['hostname'] ~ '-' ~ item }}"
deleted_lines: cat {{ haproxy_ssl_cert_path ~ '/haproxy_' ~ ansible_facts['hostname'] ~ '-' ~ item ~ '.crt' }} {{ haproxy_ssl_cert_path ~ '/haproxy_' ~ ansible_facts['hostname'] ~ '-' ~ item ~ '-ca.crt' }} {{ haproxy_ssl_cert_path ~ '/haproxy_' ~ ansible_facts['hostname'] ~ '-' ~ item ~ '.key' }} > {{ haproxy_ssl_cert_path ~ '/haproxy_' ~ ansible_facts['hostname'] ~ '-' ~ item ~ '.pem' }}

commit_message:
Run featureset002 job with tempest-allow

This patch replace the tempest_test_whitelist with tempest_allowed_group
that is to be used by tempest-allow.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-tempest-skiplist/+/839722
Testing here: https://review.rdoproject.org/r/c/testproject/+/40932
Change-Id: Iadc524ff5458afef1301786e9d2a2c326731e0c8

commit_message:
Fix page reload behaviour

Proposed patch makes designate-dashboard compatible with
[1] bugfix. Currently, pages for zone, recordset and
floating IP details  break at reload

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/horizon/+bug/1746706
Closes-Bug: #1935967

Change-Id: I84c6bcb696281cfe75e45c1f7955e2341f04dfd9

commit_message:
tripleo_nova_libvirt: add for standalone roles

Make test vars for molecule cases containing info on tags to
include/skip, and extra verification - targeted config files
and expected config lines to check in each file.

Make molecule passing skip_tags but not tags for libvirt role
testcases. That is required because its converge playbook controls
tags on its own, and adding molecule tags conflicts with it. And
because include_role cannot be used with skip_tags in ansible, instead
use molecule to control which tags to skip for converge scenarios.

Add test cases to install only (default), configure containers,
run a single one, run all. In order to allow variables overrides
for test cases needs, also import test_vars as vars files for the role.

Add idempotence scenario for default testcase of libvirt role.
TODO: custom idempotence (container manager/config template) support
for 'config' and 'run' tagged test cases that cannot pass the standard
molecule idempotence.

Co-authored-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia91e247a94b70d55be02dcd605223efcc7f26c46
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

del_qos_keys.append(k) continue if qos_val[1] is None and vol_val > v['default']: self.delete_volume_backend_qos_keys(volume, del_qos_keys) def get_volume_backend_qos(self, volume): volume_name = volume.name with RBDVolumeProxy(self, volume_name) as volume: try: current = {k.get('name'): k.get('value') for k in volume.config_list()} exception_message = (_("Failed to get qos specs for volume " "%(volume_name)s, due to " % {'vol_name': volume_name, data=exception_message) return None def update_volume_backend_qos(self, volume, qos_specs): volume_name = volume.name with RBDVolumeProxy(self, volume_name) as volume: volume.config_set(QOS_KEY_MAP[qos_key]['ceph_key'], exception_message = (_("Failed to set qos spec " "%(qos_key)s, due to " "%(error)s.") data=exception_message) def delete_volume_backend_qos_keys(self, volume, qos_specs): volume_name = volume.name with RBDVolumeProxy(self, volume_name) as volume: for key in qos_specs: try: volume.config_remove(QOS_KEY_MAP[key]['ceph_key']) exception_message = (_("Failed to delete qos spec " "%(qos_key)s, due to " "%(error)s.") data=exception_message)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ie804f5e122ecad7afb71dd686b5f6c0e73b76724

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I3acc0a817f5b8d5425d8d662d1919ac7e3cdaa0d

commit_message:
Do not reclaim sharded roots until they shrink

We don't normally issue any DELETEs to shards when an empty root accepts
a DELETE from the client.  If we allow root dbs to reclaim while they
still have shards we risk letting undeleted shards get orphaned.

Partial-Bug: 1911232

Change-Id: I4f591e393a526bb74675874ba81bf743936633c1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/86/771086/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def is_old_enough_to_reclaim(self, now, reclaim_age): return (Timestamp(now - reclaim_age) > Timestamp(info['delete_timestamp']) > Timestamp(info['put_timestamp'])) def is_reclaimable(self, now, reclaim_age): if self.is_old_enough_to_reclaim(now, reclaim_age): if self.is_root_container() and self.sharding_initiated(): # reclaim when all shard ranges have been shrunk and deleted return not self.get_shard_ranges() else: return self.empty()
deleted_lines: def is_reclaimable(self, now, reclaim_age): if (Timestamp(now - reclaim_age) > Timestamp(info['delete_timestamp']) > Timestamp(info['put_timestamp'])): return self.empty()

subject: Reset device namespace when adding to the namespace fails
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-07 10:12:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ff9b1b3f3bfc9a9a8300bd24307aa76489c0f6fc', 'message': 'Reset device namespace when adding to the namespace fails

In case when during adding device to the namespace, device will be "shy"
and will disappear for a moment and NetworkInterfaceNotFound exception
will be raised, we need to reset device.namespace to be None.
Otherwise, in the next attempt of adding interface to namespace, when it
will be added back to ovs (and will be in global scope), Neutron will
already look for it in the "namespace" and that will always be failing.

Closes-bug: #1961740
Change-Id: Ie9331c72c44084b0a382598c3359214cce2f2ebd
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-09-08 14:59:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/fdfba53ce36d664205fe4c5605a8648618562bb6', 'message': 'Reset device namespace when adding to the namespace fails

In case when during adding device to the namespace, device will be "shy"
and will disappear for a moment and NetworkInterfaceNotFound exception
will be raised, we need to reset device.namespace to be None.
Otherwise, in the next attempt of adding interface to namespace, when it
will be added back to ovs (and will be in global scope), Neutron will
already look for it in the "namespace" and that will always be failing.

Closes-bug: #1961740
Change-Id: Ie9331c72c44084b0a382598c3359214cce2f2ebd
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2022-09-09 08:28:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/interface.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_interface.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/76578393ab401a33084921c4355af8e82c5d02ee', 'message': 'Reset device namespace when adding to the namespace fails

In case when during adding device to the namespace, device will be "shy"
and will disappear for a moment and NetworkInterfaceNotFound exception
will be raised, we need to reset device.namespace to be None.
Otherwise, in the next attempt of adding interface to namespace, when it
will be added back to ovs (and will be in global scope), Neutron will
already look for it in the "namespace" and that will always be failing.

Closes-bug: #1961740
Change-Id: Ie9331c72c44084b0a382598c3359214cce2f2ebd
'}]
commit_message:
Reset device namespace when adding to the namespace fails

In case when during adding device to the namespace, device will be "shy"
and will disappear for a moment and NetworkInterfaceNotFound exception
will be raised, we need to reset device.namespace to be None.
Otherwise, in the next attempt of adding interface to namespace, when it
will be added back to ovs (and will be in global scope), Neutron will
already look for it in the "namespace" and that will always be failing.

Closes-bug: #1961740
Change-Id: Ie9331c72c44084b0a382598c3359214cce2f2ebd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/61/856261/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(slaweq) In such case it's required to reset device's # namespace as it was already set to the "namespace" # and after retry neutron will look for it in that namespace # which is wrong device.namespace = None

Update master for stable/zed

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/zed.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/zed.

Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Add instance.power_off_error notification

This patch add a notification when a share can not be umounted on the
compute host.

Manila is the OpenStack Shared Filesystems service.
These series of patches implement changes required in Nova to allow the shares
provided by Manila to be associated with and attached to instances using
virtiofs.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-virtiofs-attach-manila-shares

Change-Id: If53862447d9afddab5cd4a33fb2964866129e489
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/78/852278/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.ShareUmountError as e: compute_utils.notify_about_instance_action(context, instance, self.host, action=fields.NotificationAction.POWER_OFF, phase=fields.NotificationPhase.ERROR, exception=e)
deleted_lines: except exception.ShareUmountError: # TODO(uggla) add error notification

commit_message:
Migrate ganesha calls to privsep

Changes all the calls requiring sudo privileges to use privsep.

Change-Id: Ie6c5e3233de073aa1497afd1e34a2c832bc353c8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/71/825871/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from manila.privsep import dbus as privsep_dbus from manila.privsep import os as privsep_os privsep_os.mkdir(self.ganesha_export_dir) privsep_os.mkdir(os.path.dirname(self.ganesha_db_path)) tmpf = privsep_os.mktemp(dirpath, fname, prefix_to_append=".XXXXXX") privsep_os.write_data_to_file(pipes.quote(data), pipes.quote(tmpf)) privsep_os.move(tmpf, path) privsep_os.remove_file(tmpf) privsep_os.remove_file(path) privsep_dbus.dbus_send_ganesha(service, method, *args, **kwargs) privsep_os.remove_file( 'rm -f %s/*.conf' % pipes.quote(self.ganesha_export_dir))
deleted_lines: self.execute('mkdir', '-p', self.ganesha_export_dir) self.execute('mkdir', '-p', os.path.dirname(self.ganesha_db_path)) tmpf = self.execute('mktemp', '-p', dirpath, "-t", fname + ".XXXXXX")[0][:-1] self.execute( 'sh', '-c', 'echo %s > %s' % (pipes.quote(data), pipes.quote(tmpf)), message='writing ' + tmpf) self.execute('mv', tmpf, path) self.execute('rm', tmpf) self.execute("rm", "-f", path) self.execute("dbus-send", "--print-reply", "--system", "--dest=org.ganesha.nfsd", "/org/ganesha/nfsd/ExportMgr", "org.ganesha.nfsd.%s.%s" % (service, method), *args, message='dbus call %s.%s' % (service, method), **kwargs) self.execute('sh', '-c', 'rm -f %s/*.conf' % pipes.quote(self.ganesha_export_dir))

commit_message:
Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0

oslo.db 12.1.0 has changed the default value for the 'autocommit'
parameter of 'LegacyEngineFacade' from 'True' to 'False'. This is a
necessary step to ensure compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0. However, we
are currently relying on the autocommit behavior and need changes to
explicitly manage sessions. Until that happens, we need to override the
default.

Change-Id: I93ab8e0cce22a71efc08f73bde804d99a63b4a8d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/89/857589/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(wuchunyang): we need to remove reliance on autocommit semantics ASAP # since it's not compatible with SQLAlchemy 2.0 database_opts['autocommit'] = True

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I83e2f8e18296e87ae50ae54664105c8318dc952c

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I55a131d428f32b0404844815c5eb8768e8074770

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: Iec5b7754168062bfc194d67b24acf43b72fa2932

New roles for apache/httpd management

Those roles will help removing puppetlabs-apache
module.

subject: Support os-brick specific lock_path
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-07-11 11:20:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6365c0a6b9f46fdb1f17c9d03d8896fcbaaadf0c', 'message': "Support os-brick specific lock_path

As a new feature, os-brick now supports setting the location of file
locks in a different location from the locks of the service.

The functionality is intended for HCI deployments and hosts that are
running Cinder and Glance using Cinder backend.  In those scenarios the
service can use a service specific location for its file locks while
only sharing the location of os-brick with the other services.

To leverage this functionality the new os-brick code is needed and
method ``os_brick.setup`` needs to be called once the service
configuration options have been loaded.

The default value of the os-brick ``lock_path`` is the one set in
``oslo_concurrency``.

This patch adds support for this new feature in a backward compatible
way so code works even if using an os-brick version that doesn't have
this feature.  That is the case for many CI jobs that install os-brick
from PyPi instead of the code present in master.

The patch also ensures that ``tox -egenconfig`` includes the os-brick
configuration options when generating the sample config.

commit_message:
Support os-brick specific lock_path

As a new feature, os-brick now supports setting the location of file
locks in a different location from the locks of the service.

The functionality is intended for HCI deployments and hosts that are
running Cinder and Glance using Cinder backend.  In those scenarios the
service can use a service specific location for its file locks while
only sharing the location of os-brick with the other services.

To leverage this functionality the new os-brick code is needed and
method ``os_brick.setup`` needs to be called once the service
configuration options have been loaded.

The default value of the os-brick ``lock_path`` is the one set in
``oslo_concurrency``.

This patch adds support for this new feature in a non backward
compatible way, so it requires an os-brick version bump in the
requirements.

The patch also ensures that ``tox -egenconfig`` includes the os-brick
configuration options when generating the sample config.

Change-Id: I9f3e46c262f5b2b72fed5a4927165b3834a1c383

commit_message:
compute: Add support for microversion 2.93

Add '--reimage-boot-volume' and '--no-reimage-boot-volume parameters'
to the rebuild command to allow rebuilding of volume backed instances.

Change-Id: I4a6e30b2cf12f32202a2d9ef1ced347e1dd139f3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/14/831014/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: parser.add_argument( '--reimage-boot-volume', action='store_true', help=_('Reimage a volume backed instance. Note that this will ' 'wipe the root volume data and overwrite it with the ' 'provided image.'), ) if parsed_args.reimage_boot_volume: if compute_client.api_version < api_versions.APIVersion('2.91'): msg = _( '--os-compute-api-version 2.91 or greater is required to ' 'support the --reimage-boot-volume option' ) raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) kwargs['reimage_boot_volume'] = parsed_args.reimage_boot_volume

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iee26f414c252a4b2d1ed98b5529056155c7000f1

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I07af2992474f906611a6a1d1eee1e7466b944153

commit_message:
Extend loadbalancer reconciliation test to cover listeners

This commit extends the loadbalancer reconcilation tempest
test to cover for when the listeners are deleted on OpenStack

Implements: blueprint reconcile-openstack-resources-with-k8s
Change-Id: If14b468e9a5f7d2c1492881d5a75ac8807030c4e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-tempest-plugin refs/changes/01/818701/32 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: crd_to_delete = [({'id': self.get_kuryr_loadbalancer_crds( service_name, namespace).get('status', {}).get( 'loadbalancer', {}).get('id')}, self.lbaas.delete_loadbalancer, self.lbaas.show_loadbalancer), ({'id': self.get_kuryr_loadbalanacer_crds( service_name, namespace).get('status').get( 'listener', [])['id']}, self.lbaas.delete_listener, self.lbaas.show_listener)] for klb_crd, os_delete, _ in crd_to_delete: os_delete(klb_crd.get('id'), cascade=True) for klb_crd, _, os_show in crd_to_delete: os_show(klb_crd.get('id')) # NOTE(digitalsimboja): What if the loadbalancer is # gone first and raises NotFound exception before the loop # concludes? msg = ("Timed Out waiting for loadbalancer to be completely" " deleted") new_lsner_id = status.get('listeners', [])['id'] new_crd_ids = set([new_lb_id, new_lsner_id]) old_crd_ids = set([crd.get('id', {}) for crd, _, _ in crd_to_delete]) if (new_crd_ids == old_crd_ids or new_crd_ids is None or self.assertNotEqual(new_crd_ids, old_crd_ids) msg = ('Timed out waiting for LoadBalancer reconciliation')
deleted_lines: klb_crd_id = self.get_kuryr_loadbalancer_crds(service_name, namespace).get( 'status', {}).get( 'loadbalancer', {}).get('id') self.lbaas.delete_loadbalancer(klb_crd_id, cascade=True) self.lbaas.show_loadbalancer(klb_crd_id) msg = ("Timed Out waiting for loadbalancer %s to be completely" " deleted", klb_crd_id) if (new_lb_id == klb_crd_id or new_lb_id is None or self.assertNotEqual(new_lb_id, klb_crd_id) msg = ('Timed out waiting for LoadBalancer %s reconciliation', klb_crd_id)

subject: Add instance.power_on_error notification

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-04 07:44:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/5f1473a00f7cb40a7307d32953e3df8d5e85f384', 'message': '[WIP] Add instance.power_on_error notification

This patch add a notification when a share can not be mounted on the
compute host.

Manila is the OpenStack Shared Filesystems service.
These series of patches implement changes required in Nova to allow the shares
provided by Manila to be associated with and attached to instances using
virtiofs.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-virtiofs-attach-manila-shares
Closes-Bug: #1887471

commit_message:
Add instance.power_on_error notification

This patch add a notification when a share can not be mounted on the
compute host.

Manila is the OpenStack Shared Filesystems service.
These series of patches implement changes required in Nova to allow the shares
provided by Manila to be associated with and attached to instances using
virtiofs.

Implements: blueprint libvirt-virtiofs-attach-manila-shares

Change-Id: I8ee4301ee58b61bbaeb83fe1f802825ce4d2ff2b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/84/852084/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.ShareMountError as e: compute_utils.notify_about_instance_action(context, instance, self.host, action=fields.NotificationAction.POWER_ON, phase=fields.NotificationPhase.ERROR, exception=e)

A volume-backed server will have no image attribute (or rather the image

commit_message:
compute: Require image when rebuilding a volume-backed server

A volume-backed server will have no image attribute (or rather the image
property will be set to the empty string). As such, if you want to try
rebuild you will need to specify an image [*]. Enforce this.

[*] Before microversion 2.93, this must be the same image. However, we
don't touch on that here. This will be addressed later.

Change-Id: I6842dabd7acb4e3a78f894e55e616625757eb6a4
Story: 2010297
Task: 46290
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/30/857630/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # If parsed_args.image is not set and if the instance is image backed, # default to the currently used one. If the instance is volume backed, # it is not trivial to fetch the current image and probably better # to error out in this case and ask user to supply the image. if not server.image: msg = _( 'The --image option is required when rebuilding a ' 'volume-backed server' ) raise exceptions.CommandError(msg) image = image_client.get_image(server.image['id'])
deleted_lines: # If parsed_args.image is not set, default to the currently used one. image_id = server.to_dict().get('image', {}).get('id') image = image_client.get_image(image_id)

subject: Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-14 07:53:23.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/db/__init__.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty/commit/0ea32a2b51438b55130082e54f30fc9c97bd9d85', 'message': "Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0

oslo.db 12.1.0 has changed the default value for the 'autocommit'
parameter of 'LegacyEngineFacade' from 'True' to 'False'. This is a
necessary step to ensure compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0. However, we
are currently relying on the autocommit behavior and need changes to
explicitly manage sessions. Until that happens, we need to override the
default.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia0e9696dcaafd90f9c6daeb68c72fa2b184823fb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix compatibility with oslo.db 12.1.0

oslo.db 12.1.0 has changed the default value for the 'autocommit'
parameter of 'LegacyEngineFacade' from 'True' to 'False'. This is a
necessary step to ensure compatibility with SQLAlchemy 2.0. However, we
are currently relying on the autocommit behavior and need changes to
explicitly manage sessions. Until that happens, we need to override the
default.

Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia0e9696dcaafd90f9c6daeb68c72fa2b184823fb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cloudkitty refs/changes/79/857579/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(priteau): Remove autocommit=True (and ideally use of # LegacyEngineFacade) asap since it's not compatible with SQLAlchemy # 2.0. _FACADE = session.EngineFacade.from_config(cfg.CONF, sqlite_fk=True, autocommit=True)

commit_message:
Disable a config test if ran under the root user

The `test_conf_file_permission_denied` is designed to test
if a config file can't be read due to missing file permissions.

However if we run unit tests with the root user we will beneficiat
from the root privileges and so this test will fails. This can
be reproduced by running `tox` with `sudo`.

These changes propose to skip this test if root privileges are
detected.

Closes-bug: #1983358

Change-Id: Idd124082265032c30f83242b612d002d7093aa61
(cherry picked from commit 7b838f5c31c3219d13661ec612d750e58683cbe6)
(cherry picked from commit 966c588a0c5b973a324ebe1390f8a0f064a44540)
(cherry picked from commit 3290e603dd855f5575fc30acd213bd50670810b8)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/70/857470/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import unittest @unittest.skipIf(os.getuid() == 0, "Not supported with the root privileges")

commit_message:
A DB migration tool for API version update

This patch is the DB migration tool which enables DB migration from v1
to v2 API without service outage of the VNF.

Implements: blueprint db-migration-tool
Change-Id: I267584682b467ffc4bca296877ddcab1df29915e

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I12103bd27d7b05b6751beb72ae2121f45be4148f

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Add revert to snapshot functions on REST client

This patch adds the function rename_file and its unit test, other
functions used in the 'revert to snapshot' operation were
migrated in a previous patch.

Change-Id: I36076414de9d1d31429ffd63817631fedd5df7cc
partially-implements: blueprint netapp-ontap-rest-api-client
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/11/852211/11 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_rename_file(self): volume = fake_client.VOLUME_ITEM_SIMPLE_RESPONSE_REST orig_file_name = f'/vol/{fake_client.VOLUME_NAMES[0]}/cinder-vol' new_file_name = f'/vol/{fake_client.VOLUME_NAMES[0]}/new-cinder-vol' body = {'path': new_file_name.split('/')[3]} self.mock_object(self.client, 'send_request') self.mock_object(self.client, '_get_unique_volume_by_name', return_value=volume) self.client.rename_file(orig_file_name, new_file_name) orig_file_name = orig_file_name.split('/')[3] self.client.send_request.assert_called_once_with( f'/storage/volumes/{volume["uuid"]}/files/{orig_file_name}', 'patch', body=body) self.client._get_unique_volume_by_name.assert_called_once_with( fake_client.VOLUME_NAMES[0])

This patch contains the implmentation of the functions used in the
operations related to volume migration. The following functions
were migrated from ZAPI to REST API:

  > get_cluster_name
  > get_vserver_peers
  > create_vserver_peer
  > start_lun_move
  > get_lun_move_status
  > start_lun_copy
  > get_lun_copy_status
  > cancel_lun_copy
  > start_file_copy
  > get_file_copy_status

The unit tests related to these functions were also included
in this patch.

Co-Authored-By: Luisa Amaral <luisaa@netapp.com>

Change-Id: I16c305492bbfa3f6f25fd6e70803d47711276c0a
