subject: Fix fair internal lock used from eventlet.spawn_n
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-03 15:27:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d6e6d55dcb2b9289112bff213bbdabb8d245818f', 'message': "Fix fair internal lock used from eventlet.spawn_n

The fasteners lib in version 0.15.0 removed the
threading.current_thread workaround for eventlet[1] because eventlet
seemed to fixed the current_thread issues tracked in [2]. However the
fix for [2] only fixed half of the problem. The threading.current_thread
call works if it is called from thread created by eventlet.spawn.
However if the thread is created with eventlet.spawn_n then
threading.current_thread is still broken and returns the ID of the
python native thread.

The fasteners' ReaderWriterLock depends heavily on
threading.current_thread to decide which thread holds a lock and to
allow re-entry of that thread. This leads to the situation that
multiple threads created from spawn_n could take the same
ReaderWriterLock at the same time.

The fair internal lock in oslo.concurrency uses ReaderWriterLock and
as a result such lock is broken for threads created with spawn_n.

Note that this issue was raised with eventlet in [3] when the we
detected it via a direct usage of ReaderWriterLock in the nova test
code. As [3] did not lead to a solution in eventlet we implemented a
nova local fix for the test code in [4].

However now we detected that nova is effected outside of the test code
as well. Nova uses oslo.concurrency's fair lock in the ResourceTracker.
The oslo.concurrency fair lock is affected by this issue as it uses
ReaderWriterLock in the background.

There is an oslo.concurrency fix proposed in [5]. But until that is
merged, released and the global requirements bumped this patch
implement a nova local fix for the issue.

[1] https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/commit/467ed75ee1e9465ebff8b5edf452770befb93913
[2] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/172
[3] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/731
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/813114
[5] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.concurrency/+/855714

Closes-Bug: #1988311
Change-Id: Ia873bcc6b07121c9bd0b94c593567d537b4c1112
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2022-09-03 16:07:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/66d80ba622687c8878499aa7f26384b0e8b2bdb6', 'message': "Fix fair internal lock used from eventlet.spawn_n

The fasteners lib in version 0.15.0 removed the
threading.current_thread workaround for eventlet[1] because eventlet
seemed to fixed the current_thread issues tracked in [2]. However the
fix for [2] only fixed half of the problem. The threading.current_thread
call works if it is called from thread created by eventlet.spawn.
However if the thread is created with eventlet.spawn_n then
threading.current_thread is still broken and returns the ID of the
python native thread.

The fasteners' ReaderWriterLock depends heavily on
threading.current_thread to decide which thread holds a lock and to
allow re-entry of that thread. This leads to the situation that
multiple threads created from spawn_n could take the same
ReaderWriterLock at the same time.

The fair internal lock in oslo.concurrency uses ReaderWriterLock and
as a result such lock is broken for threads created with spawn_n.

Note that this issue was raised with eventlet in [3] when the we
detected it via a direct usage of ReaderWriterLock in the nova test
code. As [3] did not lead to a solution in eventlet we implemented a
nova local fix for the test code in [4].

as well. Nova uses oslo.concurrency's fair lock in the ResourceTracker.
The oslo.concurrency fair lock is affected by this issue as it uses
ReaderWriterLock in the background.

There is an oslo.concurrency fix proposed in [5]. But until that is
merged, released and the global requirements bumped this patch
implement a nova local fix for the issue.

commit_message:
Fix fair internal lock used from eventlet.spawn_n

The fasteners lib in version 0.15.0 removed the
threading.current_thread workaround for eventlet[1] because eventlet
seemed to fixed the current_thread issues tracked in [2]. However the
fix for [2] only fixed half of the problem. The threading.current_thread
call works if it is called from thread created by eventlet.spawn.
However if the thread is created with eventlet.spawn_n then
threading.current_thread is still broken and returns the ID of the
python native thread.

The fasteners' ReaderWriterLock depends heavily on
threading.current_thread to decide which thread holds a lock and to
allow re-entry of that thread. This leads to the situation that
multiple threads created from spawn_n could take the same
ReaderWriterLock at the same time.

The fair internal lock in oslo.concurrency uses ReaderWriterLock and
as a result such lock is broken for threads created with spawn_n.

Note that this issue was raised with eventlet in [3] when the we
detected it via a direct usage of ReaderWriterLock in the nova test
code. As [3] did not lead to a solution in eventlet we implemented a
nova local fix for the test code in [4].

However now we detected that nova is effected outside of the test code
as well. Nova uses oslo.concurrency's fair lock in the ResourceTracker.
The oslo.concurrency fair lock is affected by this issue as it uses
ReaderWriterLock in the background.

There is an oslo.concurrency fix proposed in [5]. But until that is
merged, released and the global requirements bumped this patch
implement a nova local fix for the issue.

Note that an issue[6] has been opened on fasteners to restore the
workaround[1].

[1] https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/commit/467ed75ee1e9465ebff8b5edf452770befb93913
[2] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/172
[3] https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/731
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/813114
[5] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.concurrency/+/855714
[6] https://github.com/harlowja/fasteners/issues/96

Closes-Bug: #1988311
Change-Id: Ia873bcc6b07121c9bd0b94c593567d537b4c1112
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/17/855717/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from unittest import mock_synchronized = lockutils.synchronized_with_prefix('nova-') def synchronized(*args, **kwargs): """The lockutils.synchronized decorator but patched to use the proper threading.current_thread call in an eventlet monkey patched environment. This hack can be removed once oslo.concurrency, or fasteners, or eventlet fixes this issues. See: * https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/issues/731 * https://bugs.launchpad.net/oslo.concurrency/+bug/1988311 """ def wrapper(f): # Apply oslo.concurrency's lock decorator first f = _synchronized(*args, **kwargs)(f) # Then make another wrapper around the result to make sure that the # lock is fixed before the function enters through the original # synchronized decorator taking the lock. # While it is tempting just to replace threading.current_thread with # eventlet.getcurrent in fixer() that replacement will be in place for # the whole run of ``f`` which has unexpected side effects. E.g. the # logging library calls threading.current_thread().name which is not a # valid thing for a greenlet.greenlet object returned by # eventlet.getcurrent if called from a thread created by # eventlet.spawn_n(). # So we need a more surgical change. Fortunately fasteners' # ReaderWriterLock caches the value of threading.current_thread when # the lock is initialized. So we only need to replace that cached # value to make lock local change. @functools.wraps(f) def fixer(*args, **kwargs): patched = eventlet.patcher.is_monkey_patched("thread") if not patched: # we are not eventlet monkey patched, so we don't need to do # anything return f(*args, **kwargs) import fasteners orig_lock_init = fasteners.lock.ReaderWriterLock.__init__ def wrapped_lock_init(_self, *args, **kwargs): orig_lock_init(_self, *args, **kwargs) _self._current_thread = eventlet.getcurrent with mock.patch( "fasteners.lock.ReaderWriterLock.__init__", new=wrapped_lock_init, ): return f(*args, **kwargs) return fixer return wrapper

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ibc3fbf99cf94bc11d5642ad0cb04004c91ff7485

commit_message:
Disable a config test if ran under the root user

The `test_conf_file_permission_denied` is designed to test
if a config file can't be read due to missing file permissions.

However if we run unit tests with the root user we will beneficiat
from the root privileges and so this test will fails. This can
be reproduced by running `tox` with `sudo`.

These changes propose to skip this test if root privileges are
detected.

Closes-bug: #1983358

Change-Id: Idd124082265032c30f83242b612d002d7093aa61
(cherry picked from commit 7b838f5c31c3219d13661ec612d750e58683cbe6)
(cherry picked from commit 966c588a0c5b973a324ebe1390f8a0f064a44540)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/96/856196/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import unittest @unittest.skipIf(os.getuid() == 0, "Not supported with the root privileges")

commit_message:
Adopt to latest VlanManager and functional job changes

The work for making routed networks work with multiple segments per
host, introduced new signature for VlanManager.get, requesting
segmentation_id, make networking_sfc code compatible with it.

Adopt dsvm-functional target name as [0] changed in Neutron, so the new
name of the target is dsvm-functional-gate.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/856262

Change-Id: I29173dba9cd0f5b16a05f80d6ade7ec522ca0299
Related-Bug: #1956435
Related-Bug: #1764738

subject: Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-06-22 18:12:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-manila/commit/292582b5d6fe02d3bedfdfbf25412573077f5a19', 'message': 'Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Removed Ganesha from testing as it does not work in HA mode in
r, s or t and is not supported in Queens so there should be no one
migrating through EOL OpenStack releases r, s and t.

Change-Id: I92c6ab860e5ee76253f5a39d241c5dee7e2a6a20

We should fix this. basepython = python3 passenv = HOME TERM CS_* OS_* TEST_* deps = -r{toxinidir}/src/test-requirements.txt changedir = {toxinidir}/src commands = bash -c "if [ ! -f ../*.charm ]; then echo 'Charm does not exist. Run tox -e build'; exit 1; fi" tox --version tox -e func-target {posargs}

commit_message:
Temporary make undercloud upgrade job non voting

In order to switch default ML2 plugin in Undercloud to
OVN[1] temporary make undercloud upgrade job non-voting
as OVS to OVN upgrade do not work.

This will be reverted after undercloud jobs are switched
to do upgrade from ml2 ovs to ml2 ovs[2].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/850158
[2] https://review.opendev.org/853503

Change-Id: I745dc9d69c64016ad35186d207421ec0ded4d897

commit_message:
Adopt to latest VlanManager and oslo.db changes

The work for making routed networks work with multiple segments per
host, introduced new signature for VlanManager.get, requesting
segmentation_id, make neutron-fwaas code compatible with it.

With oslo.db 12.1.0 some unit tests started to fail, with using the
CONTEXT_R/W session we can fix it.

Adopt dsvm-functional target name as [0] changed in Neutron, so the new
name of the target is dsvm-functional-gate.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/856262

Change-Id: Ie7459974f6f2358c8d9c37e66aa9cda530ecefc0
Related-Bug: #1956435
Related-Bug: #1764738

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: Ie5e188c423949284f8338eadd379c688bf84aa7d

commit_message:
Add 'ResellerAdmin' role to ceilometer user

'ResellerAdmin' operator role allows 'ceilometer' user to access
objects from all swift accounts(AUTH_*).

Closes-Bug: #1987273

Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5e0a0770726ade5208bc1945a1e8ae42fd185494
(cherry picked from commit e9c9478f3afbcee9c5abdfa6dcff302aca5b76f5)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I4757e2f8bbeaa51060894d089a2c4eb7d36d2b2c

is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/zed

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/zed branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ia4b3ff66f48cc0be040ddc717ec363b1b754b1d6

commit_message:
Revert "Revert resize: wait for events according to hybrid plug"

This reverts commit 7a7a223602ca5aa0aca8f65a6ab143f1d8f8ec1b.

That commit was added because - tl'dr - upon revert resize, Neutron
with the OVS backend and the iptables security group driver would send
us the network-vif-plugged event as soon as we updated the port
binding.

That behaviour has changed with commit 66c7f00e1d9. With that commit,
we started unplugging the vifs on the source compute host when doing a
resize. When reverting the resize, the vifs had to be re-plugged again,
regarldess of the networking backend in use. This renders commit
7a7a223602ca5aa0aca8f65a6ab143f1d8f8ec1b. pointless, and it can be
reverted.

Backport is clean from master, and the TODO that was present in the
commit message on master is removed, as its a driver interface change
and can only be done on master.

Closes-bug: 1952003
Change-Id: I3cb39a9ec2c260f422b3c48122b9db512cdd799b
(cherry picked from commit 0b0f40d1b308b29da537859b72080488560c23d4)
(cherry picked from commit c3ebe0f39e82cf1df6886cfd03fd8de62548fb26)

commit_message:
Add iDRAC Redfish firmware update test

This adds test for firmware update using iDRAC redfish.

Change-Id: I87bacfabcaf94b9b80b884d6ab576058e7411f84
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-tempest-plugin refs/changes/21/853621/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class BaremetalRedfishFirmwareUpdate(bsm.BaremetalStandaloneScenarioTest): api_microversion = '1.31' # to set the management_interface driver = 'redfish' delete_node = False image_ref = CONF.baremetal.whole_disk_image_ref wholedisk_image = True @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(BaremetalRedfishFirmwareUpdate, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.baremetal.firmware_image_url: raise cls.skipException("Firmware image URL is not " "provided. Skipping test case.") if not CONF.baremetal.firmware_image_checksum: raise cls.skipException("Firmware image SHA1 checksum is not " "provided. Skipping test case.") if not CONF.baremetal.firmware_rollback_image_url: raise cls.skipException("Firmware rollback image URL is not " "provided. Skipping test case. " "Make sure to provide correct " "firmware image URL that needs to be on " "server post test case execution.") if not CONF.baremetal.firmware_rollback_image_checksum: raise cls.skipException("Firmware rollback image SHA1 checksum " "is not provided. Skipping test case.") def _firmware_update(self, fw_image_url, fw_image_checksum): steps = [ { "interface": "management", "step": "update_firmware", "args": { "firmware_images": [ { "url": fw_image_url, "checksum": fw_image_checksum, "wait": 300 } ] } } ] self.manual_cleaning(self.node, clean_steps=steps) @utils.services('network') @decorators.idempotent_id('360e0c0e-3c17-4d2e-b052-55a932c1a4c7') def test_firmware_update(self): # WARNING: Removing power from a server while it is in the process of # updating firmware may result in devices in the server, or the server # itself becoming inoperable. # Execution of firmware test case needs careful execution as it # changes state of server, may result in break down of server on # interruption. As it deals with firmware of component, make sure # to provide proper image url path while testing with correct SHA1 # checksum of image even for rollback image on which server would be # moved during cleanup. self._firmware_update(CONF.baremetal.firmware_image_url, CONF.baremetal.firmware_image_checksum) self.addCleanup(self._firmware_update, CONF.baremetal.firmware_rollback_image_url, CONF.baremetal.firmware_rollback_image_checksum) class BaremetalIdracRedfishFirmwareUpdate(BaremetalRedfishFirmwareUpdate): driver = 'idrac' boot_interface = 'ipxe' management_interface = 'idrac-redfish' power_interface = 'idrac-redfish'

commit_message:
moved to 'python3 -m venv' to create virtualenv

In RHEL9 derivatives python3-virtualenv package is in EPEL9 now.

Change-Id: I22a14bc095f018a1276e5630bf598411c7d8cb54
(cherry picked from commit a39b3f7cda29fea59bd0ea6288df2086e59f0589)

commit_message:
Documentation sections Getting started and Basic usage edited.

Changes were made in section Getting started so it will guide user to the Basic usage section more properly.
The patch edits this section so it is more corredponding with the fact that the Basic usage section is for the user optional.

Changes were made in the seciton Basic usage so the user recognises possible usage of the ansible variables in the deployment process.
The examples were added.

Signed-off-by: Veronika Fisarova <vfisarov@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Icf1894c59145f39bb8e70301351f47d05b0d2b6d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart refs/changes/14/853414/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This guide :ref:`basic_usage` will walk you through the basic setup and execution of TripleO-Quickstart. .. note:: The guide mentioned above is reffering to the basic setup and execution that the quickstart.sh can apply by default. For more specific invocations of TripleO-Quickstart please continue with the tasks below.Keep in mind that the deployment of the undercloud and also overcloud is controlled by ansible variables that can help you specify your needs. See :ref:`configuration` section for the usage example.
deleted_lines: For the most basic invocations of TripleO-Quickstart please refer to the :ref:`basic_usage`. This quide will walk you through the basic setup and execution. This document will walk through some more basic invocations of TripleO-Quickstart once you've had success with the steps outlined in the guide.

subject: Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-05-20 19:06:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/charm-octavia-diskimage-retrofit/commit/024f89ec279562b66285de7a7c33214a8cac8fed', 'message': 'Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: Ie043b4c5a42de406756b29e32848b24ebd05635c

commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/ussuri

- start from stable/ussuri branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/ussuri for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 18.04 amd64
- Run on 18.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64

Change-Id: Ie043b4c5a42de406756b29e32848b24ebd05635c

commit_message:
Switch default ML2 plugin in Undercloud to OVN

OVN is already default ML2 plugin in Overcloud since
Stein release[1]. Let's also switch default on Undercloud
as well to have same networking stack.

We still need to keep Neutron DHCP agent running on Undercloud
as OVN do not fully support DHCP for baremetal ports yet. There will
be follow up patches for switching to OVN native DHCP once it's
fully supported, till then users can enable OVN DHCP by using
"environments/services/undercloud-neutron-ovn-dhcp.yaml" for the cases
it works like IPv4.

Also set DisableOvnDhcpForBaremetalPorts=true for the environments
where Neutron DHCP agent is deployed as ovn22.06+ without it
would trap DHCP requests and not forward those to the neutron dhcp agent.

Additionally added "environments/services/undercloud-neutron-ovs.yaml"
which can be used to Deploy Undercloud with ML2 OVS.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/593056/

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/853411
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/853489
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/850594
Change-Id: Id052325af15960a78277a38ec84c285bbc2888a7

commit_message:
Drop python3.6/3.7 support in testing runtime

python 3.6/3.7 support, project started adding python 3.8 as minimum

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/zed.html

Change-Id: I4ad4c5cc59800bc187a0ac0722c487726f7e18b3

subject: Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-13 12:35:35.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari-monitors/commit/d911b4fc0fb496925cce5fd3833e24ddf2594638', 'message': 'Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

commit_message:
Switch to 2023.1 Python3 unit tests and generic template name

This is an automatically generated patch to ensure unit testing
is in place for all the of the tested runtimes for antelope. Also,
updating the template name to generic one.

See also the PTI in governance [1].

[1]: https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

Change-Id: I1c2bd7a915d8794d81dfc8c873168c95878e33d6
